KeepToken","name":"","type":"address"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"totalRewards","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"address","name":"newOwner","type":"address"}],"name":"transferOwnership","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"unallocatedRewards","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"upgradeFinalizedTimestamp","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":true,"inputs":[],"name":"upgradeInitiatedTimestamp","outputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"","type":"uint256"}],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"},{"constant":false,"inputs":[{"internalType":"uint256","name":"interval","type":"uint256"},{"internalType":"address","name":"operator","type":"address"}],"name":"withdrawRewards","outputs":[],"payable":false,"stateMutability":"nonpayable","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"methods":{"allocateRewards(uint256)":{"details":"The given interval must be finished and unallocated. To allocate rewards correctly, any earlier intervals that are still unallocated will be allocated before the given interval. With reasonable interval lengths this should not pose a problem, and if allocating a later interval results in an out-of-gas issue, forcing the allocation of an earlier interval should fix it.","params":{"interval":"The interval to allocate."}},"eligibleButTerminated(bytes32)":{"params":{"_keep":"The keep to check."},"return":"True if the keep is terminated, false otherwise"},"eligibleForReward(bytes32)":{"details":"Keeps that close dishonorably or early are not eligible for rewards.","params":{"_keep":"The keep to check."},"return":"True if the keep is eligible, false otherwise"},"endOf(uint256)":{"details":"The end of an interval is exclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `endOf(i)` is in interval `i+1`.","params":{"interval":"The interval whose end is queried."},"return":"The end timestamp of the interval."},"getAllocatedRewards(uint256)":{"details":"This function returns correct results for any allocated interval. Dividing the allocated rewards by the number of keeps in the interval will give the correct reward for a keep in the interval. However, if a keep in the interval is terminated its reward will be returned to the pool of unallocated tokens. This will not be reflected in the return value of this function.","params":{"interval":"A previously allocated interval."},"return":"The total number of tokens allocated for keeps in the interval."},"getAllocatedRewards(uint256,address)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval","operator":"The operator"},"return":"The amount allocated"},"getIntervalCount()":{"return":"The number of explicitly specified intervals."},"getIntervalWeight(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"The percentage weight of the interval."},"getWithdrawableRewards(uint256,address)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval","operator":"The operator"},"return":"The amount withdrawable"},"getWithdrawnRewards(uint256,address)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval","operator":"The operator"},"return":"The amount already withdrawn"},"initiateRewardsUpgrade(address)":{"params":{"_newRewardsContract":"The address of a new rewards contract."}},"intervalOf(uint256)":{"details":"If the timestamp is before `firstIntervalStart`, the interval is 0.","params":{"timestamp":"The timestamp whose interval is queried."},"return":"The interval of the timestamp."},"isAllocated(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"Whether the interval has been allocated yet."},"isFinished(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"Whether the interval is finished."},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"keepsInInterval(uint256)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval."},"return":"Number of keeps created in the interval."},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,bytes)":{"details":"Adds the received amount of tokens to `totalRewards` and `unallocatedRewards`. May be called at any time, even after allocating some intervals. If the contract has been upgraded, the funding will be transferred to the new contract instead. Changes to `unallocatedRewards` will take effect on subsequent interval allocations. Intended to be used with `approveAndCall`. If the reward contract has received tokens outside `approveAndCall`, this collects them as well. The following invariant should hold right after calling this function: token.balanceOf(address(this)) == totalRewards.sub(dispensedRewards).","params":{"_from":"The original sender of the tokens. Must have approved at least `_value` tokens for the rewards contract.","_token":"The token to fund the rewards in. Must match the one specified in the rewards contract.","_value":"The amount of tokens to fund."}},"receiveReward(bytes32)":{"params":{"keepIdentifier":"A unique identifier for the keep, e.g. address or number converted to a `bytes32`."}},"receiveRewards(bytes32[])":{"params":{"keepIdentifiers":"An array of keep identifiers."}},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"reportTermination(bytes32)":{"params":{"keepIdentifier":"The terminated keep."}},"reportTerminations(bytes32[])":{"params":{"keepIdentifiers":"An array of keep identifiers."}},"rewardClaimed(bytes32)":{"params":{"_keep":"The identifier of the keep."},"return":"True if rewards have been paid out for the keep, or its termination has been reported. False otherwise."},"startOf(uint256)":{"details":"The start of an interval is inclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `startOf(i)` is in interval `i`.","params":{"interval":"The interval whose start is queried."},"return":"The start timestamp of the interval."},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"withdrawRewards(uint256,address)":{"params":{"interval":"The interval","operator":"The operator"}}},"title":"KEEP ECDSA Signer Subsidy Rewards for the Sep 2020 release."},"userdoc":{"methods":{"allocateRewards(uint256)":{"notice":"Allocate rewards for unallocated intervals up to and including the given interval."},"eligibleButTerminated(bytes32)":{"notice":"Checks if a keep is terminated and thus its rewards can be returned to the unallocated pool."},"eligibleForReward(bytes32)":{"notice":"Checks if a keep is eligible to receive rewards."},"endOf(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the timestamp corresponding to the end of the interval."},"finalizeRewardsUpgrade()":{"notice":"Finalizes the process of upgrading to another rewards contract by allocating all past intervals and then, transferring the not-yet-allocated tokens to a new rewards contract. Can be called only when the interval during which the upgrade was initiated ended. Before finalizing the upgrade, make sure all terminated groups are reported."},"getAllocatedRewards(uint256)":{"notice":"Get the total amount of tokens allocated for all keeps in the specified interval."},"getAllocatedRewards(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Get the amount of rewards allocated for the specified operator's beneficiary in the specified interval."},"getIntervalCount()":{"notice":"Get the number of intervals with explicitly specified weights. All subsequent intervals will have an implicit weight of 100."},"getIntervalWeight(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the percentage of remaining unallocated rewards that is to be allocated to the specified interval."},"getWithdrawableRewards(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Get the amount of rewards withdrawable for the specified operator's beneficiary in the specified interval."},"getWithdrawnRewards(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Get the amount of rewards already withdrawn for the specified operator's beneficiary in the specified interval."},"initiateRewardsUpgrade(address)":{"notice":"Initiates the process of upgrading to another rewards contract."},"intervalOf(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the interval number the provided timestamp falls within."},"isAllocated(uint256)":{"notice":"Return whether the specified interval has been allocated."},"isFinished(uint256)":{"notice":"Return whether the given interval is finished."},"keepsInInterval(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the number of keeps created in the specified interval."},"receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Funds the rewards contract."},"receiveReward(bytes32)":{"notice":"Sends the reward for a keep to the keep members."},"receiveRewards(bytes32[])":{"notice":"Stakers can receive KEEP rewards from multiple keeps of their choice in one transaction to reduce total cost comparing to single calls for rewards. It is a caller responsibility to determine the cost and consumed gas when receiving rewards from multiple keeps."},"reportTermination(bytes32)":{"notice":"Report that the keep was terminated, and return its allocated rewards to the unallocated pool."},"reportTerminations(bytes32[])":{"notice":"Report about the terminated keeps in batch. All the allocated rewards in these keeps will be returned to the unallocated pool."},"rewardClaimed(bytes32)":{"notice":"Return whether the given keep has already claimed rewards or had its rewards reallocated due to termination."},"startOf(uint256)":{"notice":"Return the timestamp corresponding to the start of the interval."},"withdrawRewards(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Withdraw all available rewards for the given interval. The rewards will be paid to the beneficiary of the specified operator."}},"notice":"Contract distributes KEEP rewards to signers that were part of the keeps which were created by the BondedECDSAKeepFactory contract.  /// The amount of KEEP to be distributed is determined by funding the contract, and additional KEEP can be added at any time.  /// When an interval is over, it will be allocated a percentage of the remaining unallocated rewards based on its weight, and adjusted by the number of keeps created in the interval if the quota is not met.  /// The adjustment for not meeting the keep quota is a percentage that equals the percentage of the quota that was met; if the number of keeps created is 80% of the quota then 80% of the base reward will be allocated for the interval.  /// Any unallocated rewards will stay in the unallocated rewards pool, to be allocated for future intervals. Intervals past the initially defined schedule have a weight of the last scheduled interval.  /// Keeps can receive rewards once the interval they were created in is over, and the keep has been marked as closed. There is no time limit to receiving rewards, nor is there need to wait for all keeps from the interval to be marked as closed. Calling `receiveReward` automatically allocates the rewards for the interval the specified keep was created in and all previous intervals.  /// If a keep is terminated, that fact can be reported to the reward contract. Reporting a terminated keep returns its allocated reward to the pool of unallocated nodes.name: ECDSARewards
getAllocatedRewards
getWithdrawnRewards
getWithdrawableRewards
withdrawRewards

nodes.documentation:
@notice Get the members of the specified keep, and distribute the reward
 amount between them. The reward isn't paid out immediately,
 but is instead kept in the reward contract until each operator
 individually requests to withdraw the rewards.
nodes.name: _distributeReward
ECDSARewards
getAllocatedRewards
getWithdrawnRewards
getWithdrawableRewards
withdrawRewards

nodes.documentation:
@notice Get the members of the specified keep, and distribute the reward
 amount between them. The reward isn't paid out immediately,
 but is instead kept in the reward contract until each operator
 individually requests to withdraw the rewards.
nodes.name: _distributeReward

allocateRewards(uint256).details: The given interval must be finished and unallocated. To allocate rewards correctly, any earlier intervals that are still unallocated will be allocated before the given interval. With reasonable interval lengths this should not pose a problem, and if allocating a later interval results in an out-of-gas issue, forcing the allocation of an earlier interval should fix it.

eligibleButTerminated(bytes32).return: True if the keep is terminated, false otherwise

eligibleForReward(bytes32).details: Keeps that close dishonorably or early are not eligible for rewards.
eligibleForReward(bytes32).return: True if the keep is eligible, false otherwise

endOf(uint256).details: The end of an interval is exclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `endOf(i)` is in interval `i+1`.

params.interval: The interval whose end is queried.

endOf(uint256).return: The end timestamp of the interval.

getAllocatedRewards(uint256).details: This function returns correct results for any allocated interval. Dividing the allocated rewards by the number of keeps in the interval will give the correct reward for a keep in the interval. However, if a keep in the interval is terminated its reward will be returned to the pool of unallocated tokens. This will not be reflected in the return value of this function.
getAllocatedRewards(uint256).return: The total number of tokens allocated for keeps in the interval.

getIntervalCount().return: The number of explicitly specified intervals.

getIntervalWeight(uint256).return: The percentage weight of the interval.

params._newRewardsContract: The address of a new rewards contract.

intervalOf(uint256).details: If the timestamp is before `firstIntervalStart`, the interval is 0.

params.timestamp: The timestamp whose interval is queried.

isAllocated(uint256).return: Whether the interval has been allocated yet.

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

keepsInInterval(uint256).return: Number of keeps created in the interval.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

receiveApproval(address,uint256,address,.details: Adds the received amount of tokens to `totalRewards` and `unallocatedRewards`. May be called at any time, even after allocating some intervals. If the contract has been upgraded, the funding will be transferred to the new contract instead. Changes to `unallocatedRewards` will take effect on subsequent interval allocations. Intended to be used with `approveAndCall`. If the reward contract has received tokens outside `approveAndCall`, this collects them as well. The following invariant should hold right after calling this function: token.balanceOf(address(this)) == totalRewards.sub(dispensedRewards).

params._from: The original sender of the tokens. Must have approved at least `_value` tokens for the rewards contract.
params._token: The token to fund the rewards in. Must match the one specified in the rewards contract.
params._value: The amount of tokens to fund.

params.keepIdentifier: A unique identifier for the keep, e.g. address or number converted to a `bytes32`.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * > Note: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

rewardClaimed(bytes32).return: True if rewards have been paid out for the keep, or its termination has been reported. False otherwise.

startOf(uint256).details: The start of an interval is inclusive; a keep created at the timestamp `startOf(i)` is in interval `i`.

params.interval: The interval whose start is queried.

startOf(uint256).return: The start timestamp of the interval.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: KEEP ECDSA Signer Subsidy Rewards for the Sep 2020 release.

allocateRewards(uint256).notice: Allocate rewards for unallocated intervals up to and including the given interval.

eligibleButTerminated(bytes32).notice: Checks if a keep is terminated and thus its rewards can be returned to the unallocated pool.

eligibleForReward(bytes32).notice: Checks if a keep is eligible to receive rewards.

endOf(uint256).notice: Return the timestamp corresponding to the end of the interval.

finalizeRewardsUpgrade().notice: Finalizes the process of upgrading to another rewards contract by allocating all past intervals and then, transferring the not-yet-allocated tokens to a new rewards contract. Can be called only when the interval during which the upgrade was initiated ended. Before finalizing the upgrade, make sure all terminated groups are reported.

getAllocatedRewards(uint256).notice: Get the total amount of tokens allocated for all keeps in the specified interval.

getAllocatedRewards(uint256,address).notice: Get the amount of rewards allocated for the specified operator's beneficiary in the specified interval.

getIntervalCount().notice: Get the number of intervals with explicitly specified weights. All subsequent intervals will have an implicit weight of 100.

getIntervalWeight(uint256).notice: Return the percentage of remaining unallocated rewards that is to be allocated to the specified interval.

getWithdrawableRewards(uint256,address).notice: Get the amount of rewards withdrawable for the specified operator's beneficiary in the specified interval.

getWithdrawnRewards(uint256,address).notice: Get the amount of rewards already withdrawn for the specified operator's beneficiary in the specified interval.

initiateRewardsUpgrade(address).notice: Initiates the process of upgrading to another rewards contract.

intervalOf(uint256).notice: Return the interval number the provided timestamp falls within.

isAllocated(uint256).notice: Return whether the specified interval has been allocated.

isFinished(uint256).notice: Return whether the given interval is finished.

keepsInInterval(uint256).notice: Return the number of keeps created in the specified interval.

receiveReward(bytes32).notice: Sends the reward for a keep to the keep members.

receiveRewards(bytes32[]).notice: Stakers can receive KEEP rewards from multiple keeps of their choice in one transaction to reduce total cost comparing to single calls for rewards. It is a caller responsibility to determine the cost and consumed gas when receiving rewards from multiple keeps.

reportTermination(bytes32).notice: Report that the keep was terminated, and return its allocated rewards to the unallocated pool.

reportTerminations(bytes32[]).notice: Report about the terminated keeps in batch. All the allocated rewards in these keeps will be returned to the unallocated pool.

rewardClaimed(bytes32).notice: Return whether the given keep has already claimed rewards or had its rewards reallocated due to termination.

startOf(uint256).notice: Return the timestamp corresponding to the start of the interval.

withdrawRewards(uint256,address).notice: Withdraw all available rewards for the given interval. The rewards will be paid to the beneficiary of the specified operator.

userdoc.notice: Contract distributes KEEP rewards to signers that were part of the keeps which were created by the BondedECDSAKeepFactory contract.  /// The amount of KEEP to be distributed is determined by funding the contract, and additional KEEP can be added at any time.  /// When an interval is over, it will be allocated a percentage of the remaining unallocated rewards based on its weight, and adjusted by the number of keeps created in the interval if the quota is not met.  /// The adjustment for not meeting the keep quota is a percentage that equals the percentage of the quota that was met; if the number of keeps created is 80% of the quota then 80% of the base reward will be allocated for the interval.  /// Any unallocated rewards will stay in the unallocated rewards pool, to be allocated for future intervals. Intervals past the initially defined schedule have a weight of the last scheduled interval.  /// Keeps can receive rewards once the interval they were created in is over, and the keep has been marked as closed. There is no time limit to receiving rewards, nor is there need to wait for all keeps from the interval to be marked as closed. Calling `receiveReward` automatically allocates the rewards for the interval the specified keep was created in and all previous intervals.  /// If a keep is terminated, that fact can be reported to the reward contract. Reporting a terminated keep returns its allocated reward to the pool of unallocated rewards.
